content: sl1wyib knit the rest of the heel stitches pick up 15 stitches along the side of the heel flap pick up your stitches in the space before each purl bump in the garter edge pick up one stitch in the transition between the heel flap and the instep stitches after the last purl bump this is now the bor pm or have this be a break in your magic loop knitting round 1 knit across the 30 instep stitches pm for side of foot or have this be a break in your magic loop knitting pick up one stitch in the transition between the instep and the heel flap before the first purl bump then pick up 15 stitches along the heel flap pick up your stitches in the space after each purl bump in the garter edge you now have 80 stitches on your needles - 30 stitches on needle one for the instep and 50 stitches on needle two if you have your magic loop breaks at the sides of the foot knit across the 18 heel turn stitches you are now at the stitches you pick up along the heel flap - ktbl until there are two stitches left k2tog round 2 knit across the 30 instep stitches slm ssk knit 14 tbl knit to the end of the round round 3 knit until there are two stitches left before bor k2tog round 4 knit across the 30 instep stitches slm ssk knit until the end of the round repeat rounds 3&4 until your stitch count is back down to 60sts foot continue knitting in the round without any decreases until the foot is 1 5 shorter than your desired length the sample was knit until it measured ~7 from the start of the heel turn toe the socks are finished with a wedge toe round 1 k1 ssk knit until three stitches from the side of the foot k2tog k1 slm k1 ssk knit until three stitches from bor k2tog k1 round 2 knit all repeat row 1 & 2 until there are 24 stitches left on your needles 12 on each needle ending on a round 1 kitchener bind-off the remaining stitches video tutorial for the kitchener bind-off 5 january socks by allison rose finishing work pattern twice for the left and right sock weave in all loose ends and block socks to desired shape 6 january socks by allison rose abbreviations used k knit p purl st s stitch es k2tog knit two stitches together decrease right leaning ssk slip slip knit - slip one stitch as if to knit slip another stitch as if to knit insert the left needle into the stitches and knit them together through the back loop decrease left leaning sl1wyif slip one with yarn in front - slip one stitch from the left needle to the right needle with the yarn held in front of the work sl1wyib slip one with yarn in back - slip one stitch
